tit.j: オオトノヂ・オオトノベ

sen.j: オオトノヂ・オオトノベは、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)である。
sen.e: Otonoji and Otonobe are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).
Otonoji and Otonobe are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).
Otonoji and Otonobe are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).

sen.j: 神世七代の第5代の神で、オオトノヂが男神、オオトノベが女神である。
sen.e: Otonoji and Otonobe are the 5th generations among the Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Otonoji is a god and Otonobe is a goddess.
Otonoji and Otonobe are the among the 5th generation of the Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Otonoji is a god and Otonobe is a goddess.
Otonoji and Otonobe are the among the 5th generation of the Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Otonoji is a god and Otonobe is a goddess.

sen.j: 大地が完全に凝固した時を神格化したもので、「ヂ」は男性、「ベ」は女性の意味である。
sen.e: Otonoji and Otonobe are the deification of the earth when it was completely coagulated; 'ji' in the name of Otonoji means man and 'be' in that of Otonobe means woman.
Otonoji and Otonobe are the deification of the earth when it was completely coagulated; 'ji' in the name of Otonoji means man and 'be' in that of Otonobe means woman.
Otonoji and Otonobe are the deification of the earth when it was completely coagulated; 'ji' in the name of Otonoji means man and 'be' in that of Otonobe means woman.

sen.j: また、「ト」は「ミトのマグワイ」の「ト」で、性器の象徴であるとする説もある。
sen.e: Also in a theory, 'to' in the names of Otonoji and Otonobe is thought to come from 'to' as in the 'mito no maguwai' (literally, intercourse of genitals) and therefore suggesting genitals.
Also in a theory, 'to' in the names of Otonoji and Otonobe is thought to come from 'to' as in the 'mito no maguwai' (literally, intercourse of genitals) and therefore suggesting genitals.
